intro: Arachnothryx breviflora, commonly known as the short-flowered arachnothryx, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a small shrub characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne in the axils of the leaves. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small seeds. Arachnothryx breviflora is native to tropical regions of South America and is often found in humid, shaded environments.
